H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H5235.def: = process by which events take place that cause damage, distress, hurt, and/or loss of life

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H6806.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward; ≈ often used figuratively to denote someone's journey through life

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2363.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H8254.def: = action by which humans determine the weight of an object, which is usually done with the help of a balance (scales)

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H3976.def: = contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H8538.def: literally: completeness; hence: = state in which humans are considered morally blameless, with profound moral uprightness and integrity

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H838.def: literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3971.def: = state in which humans or animals have a physical defect on their body

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H6631.def: = object which derives from or comes from another object, used for plants and, by extension, for humans

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H693.def: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H2912.def: = causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand-mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H3766.def: = process by which humans or animals sink on their knees ◄ as a result of being unable to keep standing up

H2154.def: = a project or scheme as conceived in the heart or mind, which can be either bad or good

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6414.def: = a person whose responsibility it is to give a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensure that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in vindication for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H11.def: = abode of the dead; ≈ seen as a place extremely remote from the activities of everyday life but still accessible to God

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3988.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H519.def: = woman who is the legal property of someone else; either married or eligible for marriage; her children belong to the person who owns her; ≈ because of this an  אָמָה  appears to have a somewhat higher status than a  שִׁפְחָה  even though both terms are sometimes used interchangeably

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H6485.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe a person, group, or object ► with the purpose of determining their well-being, condition, and/or integrity

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H259.def: = state in which a countable entity is one in number

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H7358.def: = part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

18.gl: to cause (someone's) eyes to grow dim

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H3682.def: literally: covering; hence: = something that is a visible proof of someone else's innocence in a certain matter

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2504.def: = area located on both sides of spine between false ribs and hip-bone; ◄ part of human body; ≈ often used to indicate the entire waist region of the body; euphemism for male genitals

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H2552.def: = process by which human or inanimate objects feel or become warm or hot

H1488.def: = causative action by which humans cut off the wool of a sheep or other animal

H3532.def: = young of a sheep, either male or female; ► eaten at Passover, and used for sacrifice; its fleece is used for clothing

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5130.def: = action by which humans hold an object in their hands and move it to and fro, ► probably in order to signal to a deity that the object in their hands is intended for them

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H248.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the human body from the shoulder to the hand; ≈ associated with action and strength

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H3802.def: = the joint between each arm and the main part of the human body; ► often used for carrying heavy weights

H7929.def: = the upper part of the human body between the head and the chest; ≈ associated with heavy burdens, and, in a more figurative way, heave responsibilities

H7070.def: = a tall grass with stiff, sharply-pointed leaves and a plume-like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof-coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility

H343.def: = extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H7613.def: = process when part of the human body is raised from a lower position

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3689.def: = area of the body located on both sides of the spine between the ribs the the hip; location where fat can accumulate

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4009.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H3524.def: = state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H3394.def: = one of the celestial bodies which govern time, seasons and other events on earth, marked by a white and cold light and seen by night

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5401.def: = action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6416.def: = state in which a matter is serious to the extent that is requires a judge to handle it

H3584.def: = process by which humans lose body volume ◄ as a result of sickness or fasting

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H423.def: = action by which the name of a deity is invoked and asked to punish a wrong-doer; ◄ contexts in which this may happen include: (1) covenants and agreements, where the deity is asked to punish those who do not obey the terms of the agreement, (2) cases  where a supposedly wrongful act has been committed, but where there is not enough certainty about the identity of the person who is responsible, and (3) in order to prevent people from committing a wrongful action, knowing that the deity's punishment will be upon them if they do so

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H4962.def: = human beings, regardless of sex and age

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H1616.def: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H2934.def: = action by which humans cause themselves to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H2243.def: = small bag formed by a folded piece of cloth; ◄ part a garment; ► used to carry small objects, ≈ which will not be visible from the outside and therefore associated with secrecy

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6206.def: = process by which humans experience an extreme fear

H1995.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea

H937.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H4940.def: = a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics

H2865.def: = state in which the surface of the soil is broken into many pieces

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H8420.def: = a written sign that serves as a way to confirm the authenticity of a document or to make it possible to identify a person or object

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7926.def: = the upper part of the human body between the head and the chest; ≈ associated with heavy burdens, and, in a more figurative way, heave responsibilities

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H6806.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward; ≈ often used figuratively to denote someone's journey through life

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H5057.def: = a person in a position of high authority over a nation, a division of priests or levites, or an army

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H8525.def: = long, narrow trench made in the soil by a plow

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H5301.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause air to flow from their nose or mouth upon an object

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H2336.def: = plant with thorns; ► useless; ≈ regarded as ugly and useless

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H2406.def: = cereal plant bearing dense four-sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

H890.def: = undesirable plant product, probably bad-smelling and inedible

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H8552.def: = process by which events reach the stage of completion

H347.def: = man; ◄ from the land of {L:Uz<SDBH:עוּץ>}; ► main character of book of Job
